nodes.bodyText: According to https://gradle.org/install/ the "current Gradle release is 6.6.1" -- why 6.4?
nodes.diffHunk:

-distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.3-bin.zip
+distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.4-bin.zip

nodes.bodyText:
According to https://gradle.org/install/ the "current Gradle release is 6.6.1" -- why 6.4?

I only updated to the least needed version according to your other link to support modules. Didn't thought about going to a higher version  in hope to get less problems through the Gradle update in combination with trying to introduce the module file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 distributionBase=GRADLE_USER_HOME
 distributionPath=wrapper/dists
-distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.3-bin.zip
+distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.4-bin.zip

nodes.bodyText: Also it seems that upgrading to 6.6.1 needs further investigation, see #328 . So I'll stick to 6.4 for this PR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@

 distributionPath=wrapper/dists
-distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.3-bin.zip
+distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-6.4-bin.zip

nodes.bodyText: #328 was merged, so this has been resolved.

nodes.bodyText: Does the resulting JAR file still run on Java 8?
Hmm. I have to reed up if Java 8 can handle the module-info. look at Nicolais book in my shelf
JPMS came with Java 9. Java 8 works with module-info.java by basically ignoring it, afaik.

JPMS came with Java 9. Java 8 works with module-info.java by basically ignoring it, afaik.

Not when the module-file is in src/main :D But I got it.
Remove this block -- might interfere with moditect
Not needed anymore, as the JAR file will contain a compiled module descriptor.
Is this "jdeps"-related configuration still needed?

Is this "jdeps"-related configuration still needed?

@siordache Are they? I just copied them from your example 🤷‍♂️
No, with 1.0.0-rc3 they are no longer needed.

Can't look at the code right now, but can you check whether you can replace this call with our internal annotation utils? (Same for TimeoutExtension.)

No it's not possible at the moment, because the PioneerAnnotationUtils are package private and both extensions are in the vintage package. If they weren't I guess we would have already changed them, when we introduced our helper class.
Hmmm Looks more like not 8 instead of 11 - and it is the module info so I would go with "copy module info" - I think the rest is implicit knowledge by java, and is easy readable via the action
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,9 @@ jobs:
         with:
           path: ~/.sonar/cache/
           key: ${{ runner.os }}-sonar
+      - name: Copy module on Java 11

nodes.bodyText: module-info.java
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,9 @@ jobs:
         with:
           path: ~/.sonar/cache/
           key: ${{ runner.os }}-sonar
+      - name: Copy module on Java 11
+        if: matrix.java != '8'
+        run: cp src/main/module/module-info-java src/main/java
